title: Hydrochloric acid
summary: Hydrochloric acid (ClH3O), also known as  muriatic acid, is an aqueous solution of hydrogen chloride (chemical formula: HCl).  It is a colorless solution with a distinctive pungent smell. It is classified as a strong acid. It is a component of the gastric acid in the digestive systems of most animal species, including humans. Hydrochloric acid is an important laboratory reagent and industrial chemical.[7][8]
